title.bibl: Magyar Tribune, March 29, 1918. Chicagoan Receives Appointment

div.bibl: Magyar Tribune, March 29, 1918. CHICAGOAN RECEIVES APPOINTMENT

body.p: Dr. Alfred Barothy well-known Hungarian doctor in Chicago just received notice that he has been appointed by the United States government to the committee for organization of the Western division of the Hungarian American Loyalty League.

Dr. Barothy has promised his full co-operation to the league officials as well as the Hungarian people. By naming Dr. Barothy for this particular assignment the government has chosen a man well worthy of the position. The name of Barothy is known wherever Hungarians are present.
